translation: Sixth and Second Part of the Dhāraṇī Method of Recitation

source_sentence: 明教大師臣法賢奉　詔譯
translation: Mingjiao dashi ministers, Faxian, in accordance with the imperial edict, translated
Next, he forms the tathāgata group samādhi mudrā.
He makes a fist with his second hand.
He puts his two thumbs together to form a seal.

source_sentence: 隨印誦前如來部三昧明作自擁護。
translation: He recites the precepts of the Tathāgata school of samādhi in response to the seal, making it his own embrace.
Next, he forms the Zonta bodhisattva fundamental mudrā.
He makes a fist with his second hand and ties it with his middle finger like a needle.
He makes his two middle fingers like needles.
He places his two head fingers at the knuckle of his middle finger.
He places his two thumbs on the sides of his head fingers.
He places them on top of his head to form the sign.
When he makes this seal, he recites the Zonta Bodhisattva's fundamental great teaching.
He recites Zonta Bodhisattva's fundamental great teaching.
He then creates a great embrace for himself.
When he sets his seal and recites the instructions, the practitioner attains the joyous regard of Zonta Bodhisattva.
He gets a joyful glance from Zonta Bodhisattva.
Next, he makes the head mudrā.

source_sentence: 以二手作合掌二拇指入掌中成印。
translation: With his second hand, he makes a seal by putting his palm together and inserting his two thumbs into his palm.
He recites the great head knowledge following the mudrā, saying.
"Om (citation needed) Zonu Uyghurī (verse 1).
He then makes the top sign.
He changes his right thumb to the previous sign.
He twists the middle knuckle of his middle finger to form a seal.
Following the seal, he recites the words of the top sheet of the mudrā.
"Om (citation needed), honored one, unh (a).
Next, he makes the seal of the knotted heart.
He makes a fist with his second hand.
He subtly extends his two fingers to form a seal.
Following the seal, he recites the mind's great mantra, saying.
"Om (citation needed) Śubha (pronounced as one).
Next, he sets the sign of the armor and helmet.
He uses the preceding supreme mudrā.
He then spreads his hands together to form the mudrā.
Following the seal, he recites the great invocation for armor, saying.
"Om (citation needed) Śubhaunda (a).
Next, he sets the mother-of-all-buns seal.
It's also called the seal of the Buddha's eye.
He bows with his palms together with his second hand.
He bends his two forefingers and twists the knuckle of his middle finger.
Putting his two thumbs inside his palms, he forms a seal to follow.

source_sentence: 印誦前甘露軍茶利大明。
translation: He seals and recites the preceding Amṛta-kuṇḍalī dhāraṇī.
Next, he makes the sign of the head honored one.
He takes his two ring fingers, puts them into his palm, and shakes them.
Next, he takes his two middle fingers like needles.
He straightens and spreads his two index fingers.
He places them on the back of his middle finger.

source_sentence: 舒二拇指安頭指第一節成印。
translation: He spreads his two thumbs and places them on the first knuckle of his head finger to form the sign.
Following the seal, he recites the honored Buddha's great teaching.

source_sentence: 曩莫三滿多(一)沒馱喃(引二)俱攞紇哩(二合三)俱攞紇哩(二合)那野(四)誦此明已。
translation: "After reciting this teaching, he took a clean bowl full of perfume and filled it with water.
He takes a clean bowl and fills it with perfume.

source_sentence: 復用甘露軍茶利大明加持七遍。
translation: Again, he used the great luminosity of Amṛta-kuṇḍalī to bless it seven times.
He starts at the northeast corner of the site of enlightenment.
He sprinkles it in all directions to purify it and dispel the demonic hindrances.
Next, he sets the invocation mudrā.
He uses the previous fundamental mudrā.
He modifies it by bending his two thumbs like hooks to form a seal.
Using this seal, he summons the noble ones.
He recites the invocation dhāraṇī following the seal, saying.

source_sentence: 伊呬婆誐嚩底(一)尊那(引)馱(引)囉尼(二)阿(引)誐蹉(三)阿(引)誐蹉(四)摩摩薄訖怛也(二合五)怛三摩曳(引)曩佐(引)哩伽(二合六)鉢囉(二合)帝(引)砌(引)難(七)鉢囉(二合)細(引)那彌(引八)誦此明已。
translation: "Ikṣvobagavatī(1) Śonā(cited) dhāraṇī(cited)(2) Ā(cited) gaccha(3) Ā(cited) gaccha(4) mamabaketaya(2)(5) tamasamayi(cited) nāsaka(cited) rika(2)(6) pala(2) ti(cited) nāman(cited)(7) pala(2) sesshin(cited)(8) After reciting this teaching, he imagines that good men and sages will be summoned to him.
He imagines that the good men and sages will come along with him.
He then recites the great dhāraṇī of Amṛta-kuṇḍalī.
After he calms down the good sages, he then forms the samādhi mudrā.
Next, he sets the samādhi mudrā.
He then recites the great teaching to offer up the seats of the good sages.
The samādhi mudrā.
He takes his right thumb.
He pinches the fingernail of his head.
With the other fingers, he forms a seal like the shape of a vajra.
Following the seal, he recites the great concentration mantra, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(引)商羯哩(引)三摩曳(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引一)誦此明已。
translation: "Om (citation needed) Śaṃkali (citation needed) Samādhi (citation needed) Śaṃkala (citation needed) He (citation needed)." After reciting this teaching, the practitioner then says, "May the bodhisattva sit at this seat.

source_sentence: 行人即言惟願菩薩處此座已。
translation: The practitioner then says, "May the bodhisattva sit here and finish his seat.
'May the bodhisattva stay here at the site of enlightenment and accept my offerings.'
Next, he recites this section of the great teaching seven times.
He then recites this part of the great teaching seven times, using the perfumed water as a patronizing factor.
He recites this part of the great teaching, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(引)左隷(引一)祖隷(引二)尊禰(引三)阿哩伽(二合)婆誐嚩底(四)鉢囉(二合)帝(引)蹉娑嚩(二合引)賀(引五)次結根本印。

He binds his two thumbs together in a closed knot.
He spreads them out flat to form the sign.
He recites the words of the great scripture three times.
He then blesses the water in front of him with the blaze.

source_sentence: 然後面東胡跪奉獻賢聖。
translation: Then, he kneels facing east and kneels down to present himself to the sages.
The great teaching said.

source_sentence: 唵(引)迦摩攞娑嚩(二合引)賀(引一)獻閼伽已。
translation: "Om (citation needed) kamala svāhā (citation needed) he (citation needed) offered up the guardian scriptures.
He then used the seal of Amṛta-kuṇḍalī.
He recited the great dhāraṇī of Amṛta-kuṇḍalī.
He then formed the vajradhātu as a protective embrace.
Next, he formed the boundary of the ten directions.
Putting his hands together, he does so with his right hand.

source_sentence: 先用右手中指無名指及左手頭指。
translation: First, he uses the middle finger of his right hand, the ring finger, and the first finger of his left hand.
He places the first knuckle of the little finger of his left hand.

source_sentence: 却以左手中指無名指及右手頭指。
translation: Then, he takes the middle finger of his left hand, the ring finger, and the head finger of his right hand.
He places the first knuckle of the little finger of his right hand.
The remaining tip of the little finger acts like a needle.

source_sentence: 復以拇指安頭指第一節成印。
translation: Again, he places his thumb on the first knuckle of his head finger to form a seal.
When he makes this sign, he recites the knot of the ten directions of the vajra in response to the sign.

source_sentence: 隨印誦結十方金剛界大明曰。
translation: Following the seal, he recites the great teaching on the ten directions of the vajradhātu, which says.

source_sentence: 即用前印磔開拇指成印。
translation: That is, he uses the preceding seal to open his thumb and form a seal.
Following the seal, he recites the half-jarāra dhāraṇī, saying.

translation: "Rātanāyana (sextuplets), vajra (sextuplets), and nadir (sextuplets).
Using the previous sign, he modifies it by placing his two thumbs together.
Straighten it down like a needle to form a seal.

source_sentence: 隨印誦結下方界大明曰。
translation: Recite it after the seal, then form a great dhāraṇī of the lower boundaries, saying.

source_sentence: 囉怛曩(二合)嚩日囉(二合)曩底(一)唵(引)枳哩(二)枳哩(三)嚩日囉(二合)嚩日哩(四)部晚達儞(引五)吽(引)癹吒(半音六)次結大烏瑟膩沙印。

Putting his hands together, he bends his two ring fingers into his palm and binds them together.

source_sentence: 二無名指屈入掌二中指如針。
translation: He bends his two ring fingers into his palm and places his two middle fingers like needles.
He places the third knuckle of his two thumbs in place.
Again, he takes his thumb and ring finger like a needle.
He pinches the third knuckle with his pinky finger.
Again, he uses his pinky finger like a needle to place it on his head finger.
He makes a seal like the sign for the formation of the vajra.

source_sentence: 隨印誦烏瑟膩沙大明曰。
translation: Following the seal, he recites the great dhāraṇī of udumbara, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(引)商羯哩(引一)摩賀(引)三摩曳(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引二)以如是等印及大明。
translation: "Om (citation needed) Śaṃkali (citation needed) (1) Mahā (citation needed) (3) Samāyī (citation needed) Śaṃkali (2) (citation needed) (2) Using these signs and great instructions, he creates a boundary.
After creating a boundary, the practitioner pays respect to the Bhagavān, the good and the noble.

source_sentence: 行人向於本尊賢聖恭敬作禮。
translation: The practitioner pays respectful homage to the Bhagavān, the Bhagavān, and the sages.
Next, he forms the fundamental mudrā.

source_sentence: 以二手拇指屈中節成印。
translation: He uses his second hand to bend his thumb over the middle knuckle to form a seal.
He recites the great teaching while tying this seal.
[Screw*moon] kneels down and offers the patron's robe.
He bathes the worthy and noble in the great teaching, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(引)左娑嚩(二合引)賀(引一)次結塗香印。
translation: "Om (citation needed) left svāhā (citation needed) he (citation needed) next makes the sign for coating incense.

source_sentence: 以右手拇指安頭指第一節。
translation: He takes his right thumb and places it on the first knuckle of his head finger.
Spread it out again to form the mudrā.
With this seal, he recites the great incense-coated mantra, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(引)尊娑嚩(二合引)賀(引一)次結華印。
translation: "Om (citation needed), honored one, Skt. svāhā (citation needed), and He (citation needed). Next, he makes the sign for flowers.
Take the thumb of your right hand.

source_sentence: 與頭指第一節相捻成印。
translation: Twist the first knuckle of your head finger together to form a seal.
Offer up the flower with this seal.
He recites the flower dhāraṇī, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(引)尊娑嚩(二合引)賀(引一)次結香印。
translation: "Om (citation needed), honored one, sahā-vahā (citation needed)," and then he makes the incense mudrā.

source_sentence: 以右手中指與拇指相捻成印。
translation: Use the middle finger and thumb of your right hand to twist together to form a seal.

source_sentence: 以此印獻燒香誦香大明曰。
translation: Using this seal, he offers up incense for burning and recites the great incense saying.

source_sentence: 唵(引)隷(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引一)次結燈印。
translation: "Om (citation needed)," (citation needed), and "Skt. svāhā (binary)," (citation needed).
Take the thumb of your left hand.
Pinch the knuckles of your middle fingers together to form a seal.
With this seal, he recites the great dedication of the lamp, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(引)禰(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引一)次結出生印。
translation: "Om (citation needed) 禰 (citation needed) Śākyamuni (citation needed) 賀 (citation needed).

source_sentence: 以左手拇指安中指第一節成印。
translation: Take your left thumb and place it on the first knuckle of your middle finger to form the sign.
Putting this seal on, he offers food.
He recites the great invocation for offering food, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(引)祖娑嚩(二合引)賀(引一)如是結印誦明。
translation: "Om (citation needed) zu sahā (binary citation) he (citation needed)." He thus forms the sign and recites the words.
He makes various offerings.

source_sentence: 奉獻曼拏羅中一切賢聖已復作觀想。
translation: After making offerings to all the sages in the maṇḍala, he then contemplates them.

source_sentence: 於一切世間見聞所有一切供具。
translation: "In all the world, he sees and hears all the offerings.

source_sentence: 行人運心以此供養十方一切賢聖。
translation: The practitioner makes these offerings to all the noble ones in the ten directions with this mind.
He then makes the mudrā of universal offerings.
After bowing with his palms together, he salutes them.
Then, he interlocks his two fingers to form a seal.
Following the seal, he recites the great teaching on universal offerings, saying.

source_sentence: 曩莫薩哩嚩(二合)沒馱(一)冒地薩埵(引)喃(引二)薩哩嚩(二合)他(引三)烏訥誐(二合)帝(引)娑婆(二合)囉呬[牟*含](四)誐誐曩劍娑嚩(二合引)賀(引五)如是普供養已。
translation: "In the past, he recited this great statement of universal offerings: 'Anā mo sarīva (duo) buddha (a) bodhisattva (citation) mang (citation) sarīva (duo) tath (citation) uṇuga (duo) ti (citation) svā (duo) fre [mu*hā] (d) gagha (duo) kan svā (duo) he (citation) v. After making these universal offerings, he praised the Three Treasures with a verse.
Next, he praised the Three Treasures in verse.

source_sentence: 及觀自在金剛手菩薩等。
translation: He praised the Three Treasures and Avalokitêśvara Vajrapāṇi Bodhisattva.
They praised the Buddha, saying.

source_sentence: 我佛大慈悲　　調伏諸有情
translation: "We, the Buddha, are greatly compassionate and tame all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 住福功德海　　是故我讚禮
translation: "Because I abide in an ocean of merit, I praise you.
They praise the Dharma, saying.

source_sentence: 離慾樂寂靜　　能斷諸惡趣
translation: "Being free of desire and enjoying tranquility, it's possible to end the bad destinies.

source_sentence: 純一真如理　　是故我讚禮
translation: pure unity of reality is the principle, and therefore I praise it
He praised the saṃgha, saying.

source_sentence: 堅固持尸羅　　證得解脫道
translation: "Śīlâditya firmly establishes the path to liberation.

source_sentence: 住最功德剎　　是彼我讚禮
translation: "This is my salutation for abiding in the most meritorious blaze.
"Praise be to the noble ones.

source_sentence: 怛鑁(二合引)禰(引)尾颯鉢多(二合)[口*尒]曩俱胝囉毘鉢囉(二合)瑜(引)誐(引一)捺也(二合)娑多(二合)捺也(二合)他(引)鉢那欲帝(引)曩左隷(引)祖隷曩(二)欲訖多摩試沙訥哩多鉢囉(二合)舍摩(引)野尊禰(引三)莎(引)賀(引)嚩帝(引)三摩囉底怛寫俱覩(引)尾鉢底(四)薩哩嚩(二合)沒馱曳(二合)鉢囉(二合)設娑多(二合引)野三勃哩(二合引)跢(引)野虞尼(引)哩虞(二合)嚕(五)阿嚩路吉多塞倪也(二合)野曩謨(引)[寧*吉](切身)怛也(二合)摩賀(引)怛摩(二合)儞(引六)摩賀(引)摩攞(引)野贊拏(引)野尾儞也(二合引)囉(引)惹(引)野娑(引)達吠(引七)訥哩難(二合引)多那摩迦(引)野室左(二合)曩摩悉帝(二合引)嚩日囉(二合)播(引)拏曳(引八)復次行人如是讚歎已。
translation: "After praising them in this way, the monk Tathāgata praised them.
He also said, "Repent!

source_sentence: 弟子某甲自從無始已來至於今日。
translation: "Since beginningless time, certain disciple has been here up to this day.
In the cycle of rebirth, he created unwholesome actions.
Either he did it himself or taught it to others.

source_sentence: 乃至見聞隨喜一切不善。
translation: What's more, I've seen, heard, and liked everything that's unwholesome.
Now, I reveal my repentance to the Three Treasures.

source_sentence: 從今已去奉持禁戒更不復作。
translation: From now on, I'll observe the precepts and never do it again.
Furthermore, since today, I've gone.

source_sentence: 所有諸大菩薩緣覺聲聞。
translation: All the great bodhisattvas, pratyekbuddhas, and direct disciples.

source_sentence: 乃至一切眾生所作善法。
translation: ...and all sentient beings who do good deeds.
I'll follow them all.
After he said this, he then tied the fundamental mudrā.
He recites the fundamental mudrā three times.
The practitioner then put his palms together and said.

source_sentence: 某甲上來所作供養多不周備。
translation: 'My predecessors' offerings were often ill-equipped.
Perhaps they forgot the order and didn't follow the rules of the Dharma.
May it be the wish of the bodhisattvas and all the good and noble people.
Be joyful and generous with great kindness and compassion.
Next, he makes the sign of guarding the skin.
He uses the previous fundamental mudrā to change his thumb.
He places the first knuckle of his head finger in the mudrā.
Following the seal, he recites the great mantra of guarding the bodhisattva's name, saying.

source_sentence: 唵左隷(引一)祖隷(引二)尊禰(引三)阿哩伽(二合)婆誐嚩底鉢囉(二合)帝(引)蹉娑嚩(二合引)賀(引四)復次行人。
translation: "Om zuo guan (citation 1) zu guan (citation 2) zun-hen (citation 3) ariega (binary) po gha ti po lah (binary) ti (citation) cha svasti (citation) he (citation 4) Furthermore, the practitioner contemplates himself as Venerable Nāgârjuna Bodhisattva.
He contemplates himself as Venerable Śubha Bodhisattva.
First, he forms a sign.
With his second hand, he makes a vajra fist.
He takes his two forefingers and little finger and forms them like needles.
Next, he spreads his other fingers like needles to form a seal.
When he makes this seal, he observes himself as Venerable Nāgasena Bodhisattva.
He contemplates himself as Zonta Bodhisattva.
On his head, he shows the Sanskrit letter om.
It's the Tathāgata udāna.
Next, he shows the word left in his two eyes.
It becomes the great Uthiranīṣa wheel.
Next, he shows the word Ām on his neck.
It becomes the Acala Radiant King.
He's holding a conch and a noose in his hand.
Next, he shows the character 卒 in his mind.
He becomes the bodhisattva Avalokitêśvara.
Next, he shows the word palm on both arms again.
He becomes the luminous accumulation of luminous kings.
Next, he again shows the character śramaṇa in his mind.
He becomes a good sage.

source_sentence: 面有三目手執蓮華羂索軍持等。
translation: His face has three eyes, and his hands are holding lotus flowers, baskets, armies, and so forth.
Next, the character 卒 appears again in his navel chakra.
It's the costumed honored one, Zonta Bodhisattva.
Next, the Sanskrit phoneme 禰 appears on both his thighs.
He becomes the Vajrapāṇi Bodhisattva.
Next, he shows the Sanskrit phoneme ṣa in his two jaws.
He becomes the bodhisattva Ikṣvākuṭa.
His face has three eyes and six arms, and his body is blue in color.
He uses elephant skin as his robe.
Next, he shows the Sanskrit phoneme he at his two feet.
He becomes the bodhisattva Vajrāṇakṣema.
It's the color of glass.
After thus contemplating it, he then recites it.
There are also two kinds of ways to recite this.
One is without marks, and the other has marks.
Those who recite without form should first sit cross-legged with the seal of meditation.
First, he puts on the seal of meditation and sits cross-legged.
He sits cross-legged with his body upright and his mind with his neck slightly bowed.
At the tip of his nose, he contemplates his breath coming in and out.
It's neither crude nor fine, not slow or hasty.

source_sentence: 心緣大明專注持誦勿令間斷。
translation: He focuses his mind on the great luminosity and intently recites it without letting it stop.
Don't let your mind become fatigued, either.
Such continued chanting is called supreme.

source_sentence: 有相持誦者即持珠定數。
translation: Those who recite with form are those who hold the beads a set number of times.
Each time he recites it, he must recite it measurelessly.
It goes on until he attains the stage of accomplishment.
He mustn't lose even a single one.
If he lacks one number, it's called interruption.

source_sentence: 於所求事不獲成就每欲持誦先結數珠印。
translation: Whenever he wants to recite it, he first makes the sign for the number of beads.
Take the middle knuckle of the first finger of your ring finger and bend it.
Twist the middle knuckle of your middle finger together to form a seal.
Following the seal, he recites the words of the great scripture.
